unit_learning_outcomes.description: Document a financial decision making problem and its solution using spreadsheet software and communicate the results to interested stakeholders.
Build the financial models and perform the calculations to implement these methods using microsoft excel.
Understand current established methods for the valuation and appraisal of investment projects, their advantages and disadvantages and the development of financial models for this purpose.
Demonstrate an introductory understanding of the “real options approach” to investment appraisal.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Preparation for seminars/lectures and various assessment items.

enrolment_rules.description: ACST603 or ACST6003 or admission to MActPrac

assessments.description: This is an individual assignment which focuses on building financial models and performing the calculations to implement these methods using an Excel spreadsheet.
The class test will be 60 minutes open-book online exam with no reading time, to be held during the lecture time.
The class test will be 60 minutes open-book written paper with no reading time, to be held during the lecture time.
The final examination will be a 2 hour examination with ten minutes reading time.
This is an individual assignment which focuses on building financial models and performing the calculations to implement these methods using an Excel spreadsheet.

data.subject_search_title: ACST8029 - Capital Budgeting and Financial Modelling

academic_org.value: Department of Actuarial Studies and Business Analytics

data.description: This unit covers established methods for the valuation and appraisal of investment projects and related financial decisions. It also covers the new 'real options approach' to investment appraisal, including the application of exotic options pricing formulae to real options using Microsoft Excel to build financial models, and introducing students to Visual Basic/Excel macros for financial modelling.
data.search_title: ACST8029 - Capital Budgeting and Financial Modelling
data.title: Capital Budgeting and Financial Modelling

description: This unit covers established methods for the valuation and appraisal of investment projects and related financial decisions. It also covers the new 'real options approach' to investment appraisal, including the application of exotic options pricing formulae to real options using Microsoft Excel to build financial models, and introducing students to Visual Basic/Excel macros for financial modelling.
title: Capital Budgeting and Financial Modelling
